title: Job Vacancies at Lagos Food Bank
content:
Lagos Food Bank is a non-profit, nutrition-focused initiative committed to fighting hunger, reducing food waste and solving the problem of malnutrition through targeted programs that seek to improve the nutrition/food intake of pregnant women and their infants who are not able to get the required nutrient during pregnancy and breastfeeding of their babies.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Communications Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Communications Officer supports the food bank by creating clear, engaging communications that raise awareness of food insecurity, promote services, and strengthen community support.
	The role involves managing social media and website content, producing stories and marketing materials, coordinating media relations, and supporting campaigns and events.
	The Communications Officer helps ensure consistent, positive messaging across all channels to enhance the food bank’s visibility, engage donors and volunteers, and highlight community impact.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with experience.
	Applicants must live close to the food bank to ensure reliable on-site support.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their applications to: hr@lagosfoodbank.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Volunteer Management Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Volunteer Management Officer supports the food bank by overseeing, coordination, and engagement of volunteers to ensure smooth daily operations.
	The role involves managing volunteer schedules, delivering training, and fostering a positive and inclusive volunteer experience.
	Using strong data analytics skills, the officer tracks volunteer metrics, identifies trends, and provides insights to improve efficiency and support reporting needs.
	The position requires critical thinking to solve operational challenges, optimize processes, and ensure compliance with safety and organizational standards.
	Strong project management abilities are essential for planning volunteer initiatives, organizing community outreach events, and coordinating special projects that enhance the food bank’s impact and capacity.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with experience.
	Applicants must live close to the food bank to ensure reliable on-site support.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their applications to: hr@lagosfoodbank.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Fundraising Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description


	We’re seeking a motivated and community-focused Fundraising Officer to help grow and sustain the vital work of our food bank.
	In this role, you will develop and deliver fundraising campaigns, build relationships with donors and partners, coordinate community events, and identify new funding opportunities.
	You will manage grant applications, maintain accurate donor records, and support outreach efforts to raise awareness of our mission.
	The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator, highly organized, and passionate about tackling food insecurity.
	This position plays a key role in ensuring we have the resources needed to support vulnerable families.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with experience.
	Applicants must live close to the food bank to ensure reliable on-site support.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their applications to: hr@lagosfoodbank.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales Executive (Lubricants)",
  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive&nbsp;(Lubricants)
Job Location:&nbsp;Asaba, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Lubricants/ Automotive

About the Role


	The Sales Executive is responsible for generating sales, managing client accounts, and expanding the company&rsquo;s market share for industrial and automobile lubricant products.
